hotspots.label: Parent Bird's Eye
hotspots.fact: This bird has a large, bright eye that helps it see very well to find food and watch for danger. Birds use their eyes to sense their environment, which is one of their important body structures. This is called **sensing** — that's when an animal uses its body parts like eyes to notice things around it.

vocabulary.definition: When an animal uses body parts like eyes, ears, or nose to notice and learn about the world around it.

hotspots.label: Chicks (Baby Birds)
hotspots.fact: These are baby birds called chicks, and they look different from the adult bird caring for them. Over time, chicks will grow feathers and learn to fly just like their parent. This change from baby to adult is part of an animal's **life cycle** — that's all the stages a living thing goes through from birth to adulthood.

vocabulary.definition: All the different stages an animal goes through in its life, from being born as a baby to growing into an adult.

hotspots.label: Curved Beak
hotspots.fact: This bird has a long, curved beak that is shaped just right for picking up small seeds and food from the ground. The beak is a special body structure that helps this bird survive and get the food it needs. This is an example of how animals have **adaptations** — special body parts that help them live in their environment.

vocabulary.definition: A special body part or skill that helps an animal survive and live in its environment.

hotspots.label: Straw and Nest
hotspots.fact: The parent bird built this nest from straw and plant material to provide a safe home for its chicks. The nest is part of the bird's **habitat** — the place where this animal lives and finds everything it needs to survive. A good habitat gives birds shelter, food, and a safe place to raise their babies.

vocabulary.definition: The place where an animal lives that has all the things it needs, like food, water, shelter, and space.
